title: Czech Republic: Citibank Donates Almost CZK 4 Million for CSR Projects In 2012
summary: Prague - Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) projects are a core component of Citibank's corporate culture and rank among the bank's most important corporate values. Citibank has actively contributed to a broad range of projects again this year, supporting them with almost CZK 4 million. The projects cover areas such as financial education and social business, and also include a large number of philanthropic activities pursued in collaboration with non-profit organizations in the Czech Republic.
tag-1: Czech Republic: Citibank Donates Almost CZK 4 Million for CSR Projects In 2012
tag-2: Prague – Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) projects are a core component of Citibank's corporate culture and rank among the bank's most important corporate values. Citibank has actively contributed to a broad range of projects again this year, supporting them with almost CZK 4 million. The projects cover areas such as financial education and social business, and also include a large number of philanthropic activities pursued in collaboration with non-profit organizations in the Czech Republic.
tag-3: "Citibank in the Czech Republic feels a responsibility to engage with and support the communities in which we live and work. Accordingly, Citibank's Corporate Social Responsibility activities cover a broad range of issues, and we are proud of our long tradition supporting and working with our CSR partners in the Czech Republic," says Eva Chaloupková, Citibank's Public Affairs Officer for the Czech Republic and Slovakia.
tag-4: Citi Foundation Citibank has long focused on financial education, which it supports through grants awarded by the Citi Foundation. The bank has been collaborating in this area with select partners from the ranks of non-profit organizations for a number of years. Through its long-term strategic support for financial capability, the Citi Foundation seeks to help to guide the Czech public towards financial responsibility and improve the public's financial capability, open up a debate among experts on these issues and help put in place a clear-cut, fully sufficient and carefully planned educational scheme at the national level.
tag-5: This year, Citibank and Masaryk University launched a pilot project called the Financial Capability Program, which follows up on the conclusions drawn from an in-depth survey conducted last year and those of the conference entitled 'How to properly financially educate adults.' The aim of the project is to develop a sustainable framework for the systematic financial education of adults, with a potentially nationwide reach. As part of their curriculum, university students acquire financial education and the skills required to disseminate it farther afield.
tag-6: Supported by Citibank, Prosperita o.p.s. has for four years organized training courses called 'Learn to Manage Your Business,' intended for people wishing to start up a business. In these courses, start-up business owners study the theoretical and practical aspects of running a business. Since the launch of this program, nearly 300 people have taken an active part in the courses, and 50 percent of them have actually started up their own successful business.
tag-7: Citibank has been working with the Junior Achievement organization for 15 years, including financial education for high school students through the 'JA Banks in Action' computer-based competition. Its purpose is to provide young students with the required financial knowledge and skills that will motivate them to continue their education which they will be able to use in their future careers as well as in their everyday lives. 'JA Banks in Action' is a computer simulation in which student teams (each representing a fictitious financial institution) compete with each other on the financial market. Through this program, students have an opportunity to gain insight into the inner workings of banks; for example, they can try out decision-making on interest rates and learn about certain specifics of the banking market.
tag-8: Citibank also helps to empower Czech non-governmental non-profit organizations' social business through its support for the 'Accelerator' program organized by the Via Foundation.
tag-9: Citibank Employee Charity Fund The projects of Czech non-profit organizations are usually geared towards supporting variously disadvantaged groups of the population, and Citibank assists them, on a one-off or short-term basis, with financial gifts from its Citibank Employee Charity Fund. The Fund is comprised of employee contributions, with a matching contribution provided by the bank, and is allocated twice a year to those non-profit organizations operating in the Czech Republic that satisfy certain formal requirements and submit an official grant application. Since 1996, when the Citibank Employee Charity Fund was founded, more than CZK 8 million has been distributed to support some 300 of non-profit organizations' projects.
tag-10: Volunteering and philanthropy Citibank also encourages its employees to engage in volunteer work. Every employee is entitled to use one day per year to help out in the non-profit sector. Every year, Citibank in the Czech Republic organizes a volunteering day for Citi's Global Community Day. Citibank's employees have a range of volunteering activities in the Czech Republic to choose from, and spend the day working in various non-profit organizations. Some 150 of Czech Citibank's employees join in every year.
tag-11: In the Czech Republic, Citibank also organizes, on a regular basis, collections of clothing in support of many non-profit organizations. It also gives tangible gifts to these groups, such as discarded office furniture, etc. Twice a year, Citibank organizes charity bazaars, where employees can buy products from protected workshops [i.e., staffed by the disabled]. We always respond to the latest developments and organize fundraising drives in the event of natural disasters and similar contingencies.
tag-12: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citigroup provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-14: Citi Foundation The Citi Foundation is committed to the economic empowerment and financial inclusion of individuals and families, particularly those in need, in the communities where we work so that they can improve their standard of living. Globally, the Citi Foundation targets its strategic giving to priority focus areas: Microfinance, Enterprise Development, Youth Education and Livelihoods, and Financial Capability and Asset Building. The Citi Foundation works with its partners in Microfinance and Enterprise Development to support environmental programs and innovations. Additional information can be found at www.citifoundation.com.
